param.label: Substitution model
param.option: LG - Generalist empirical model from Le and Gascuel (2008)
WAG - Generalist empirical model from Whelan and Goldman (2001)
JTT - Generalist empirical model from Jones, Taylor, and Thornton (1996)
JC69 - Generalist empirical model from with equal exchangeability rates
mtMet - Specialist empirical model for metazoan mitochondrial genomes
mtVer - Specialist empirical model for vertebrate mitochondrial genomes
mtInv - Specialist empirical model for invertebrate mitochondrial genomes
gcpREV - Specialist empirical model for green plant chloroplast genomes
HIVBm - Specialist empirical model for between-host HIV sequences
HIVWm - Specialist empirical model for within-host HIV sequences

param.label: Posterior estimation method
param.help: The inference method to use for estimating the posterior distribution.

param.label: Number of MCMC chains
param.help: The number of MCMC chains to run.

param.label: Length of each chain
param.help: The length of each MCMC chain.

param.name: samples
param.label: Samples to use for burn-in
param.help: The number of samples to discard from the beginning of each MCMC chain.

param.name: samples_per_chain
param.label: Samples to draw from each chain
param.help: The number of samples to draw from each MCMC chain after the burn-in period.

param.name: gencodeid
param.label: Genetic code
param.help: Which genetic code should be used
param.option: Mold, Protozoan and Coelenterate mt; Mycloplasma/Spiroplasma
Ciliate, Dasycladacean and Hexamita Nuclear code

param.label: Kill zero-length branches
param.help: Automatically delete internal zero-length branches for computational efficiency
param.option: Automatically delete internal zero-length branches for computational efficiency (will not affect results otherwise)
Keep zero-length branches, but constrain their values to 0

param.name: mss_type
param.label: How to partition synonymous codons into classes
param.option: Each set of codons mapping to the same amino-acid class have a separate substitution rate (Valine == neutral)
Each set of codons mapping to the same amino-acid class have a separate substitution rate (mean = 1)
Each pair of synonymous codons mapping to the same amino-acid class and separated by a transition have a separate substitution rate (no rate scaling))

Each pair of synonymous codons mapping to the same amino-acid class and separated by a transition have a separate substitution rate (Valine == neutral). All between-class synonymous substitutions share a rate.
Each codon pair that is exchangeable gets its own substitution rate (fully estimated, mean = 1)
Random partition (specify how many classes; largest class = neutral)
Load a TSV file with an empirical rate estimate for each codon pair
Load a TSV partition from file (prompted for neutral class)
Load a TSV partition for pairs of codons from a file (prompted for neutral class)
